column2: (verb) to heat a liquid unti it changes to a gas an then make it a liquid again by cooling
(adj) used to describe someone who makes money by starting their own business, especially when this involves seeing a new opportunity and taking risks
(verb) to remove or take out something
(verb) to attempt to decide on a piece or conditions that are acceptable to the person selling the goods an the person buying them, usually bi arguing
(adj) extremely brave and showing no fear od dangerous situations
(noun) a person whose job is to buy and sell products in large amounts, especialy by trading with other countries
(adv) when considering an amount of something as a part of a whole
(noun) the first example of something, such as a machine or other industrial product, from which all later forms are developed
(noun) something given in exchange for good behaviour or good work
(noun) a vehicle or aircraft travels regularly between two places
